area_name: Mid West - Lower Middle Wall, The

content.description:
Wrong Way Up - 5.7 ** (90') G

Climbs the face right of the blunt arete at the far left end of the lower side of the crag (starting about 50' down and right of "Turning of the Tide"), starting at the lowest broad ledge (it's possible to start on the 2nd ledge up and avoid the awkward lower crux on the lower headwall, but then you'd be taking the wrong way up..., and you'd still not avoid the 2nd high crux).
content.protection: Gear - lots of finger to fist sized vertical and horizontal placements possible.
content.location: Begin about 20' right of the lowest left end of the crag (small cairn below first step). Chain anchors on top

content.description:
Turning of the Tide - 5.10a *** (80â€™) F(7b)

On the far left end of the Lower Middle Wall, climb the small buttress to the chains at the lip of the large shrubby lower ledge. Begins with an easy start (5 or 6ish) and gets progressively harder to the tricky crux near the top. Consistently fun climbing on great rock.
content.location: Climbs the outer corner of the at the far south (left) end of Lower Middle Wall.

content.description:
Low Down Dog - 5.7** (50') F(4b)

Begin 10' right of Happy Rolling Cowboy and climb the face (up progressively harder moves) to the directional/top bolt then traverse left to share the chain anchors with that other route.
content.location: At the far right end of the lower wall.

content.description:
Impossible Groove - 5.6** (60') F(3b)

Climbs up the middle of the lower face beginning directly behind the large clump of Elderberries. Interesting (hard for the grade) climbing for 45' leads to the large middle ledge with the two chain anchors above.
content.protection: fixed - 3 bolts. 2 chain anchors above the top ledge.
content.location: Middle of the lower face beginning behind the Elderberry.

content.description:
Happy Rolling Cowboy - 5.6* (45') G/F(3b)

On the right (N) end of the lower wall, begin under the right end of the huge roof and climb directly to the two chain anchors. Also possible to protect with gear so this makes a great training climb for new trad climbers.
content.protection: Fixed - 3 bolts to 2 chain anchors. Also possible to lead with gear (medium cams).
content.location: At the right end of the lower wall below the right end of the big roof.

pathTokens: Mid West - Lower Middle Wall, The
